column4: My sound in VLC doesn't work, and it doesn't work in TOTEM either, can anyone help me? ._.
like, in Gnome, do you see the volume control?
it works in amaroK and so on, with mp3s and stuff like that
do you know what you are using? Are you using ALSA or OSSD?
hmm, damn, I forgot how we find out.  I have had the same problem.
try mplayer instead of VLC, i know it kind of sucks becaise its much more limited but it still works.
ok :/.. I really like VLC but i don't remember how to fix it
go into preferences of your VLC, under Audio, click the Advanced tab and play without the output sound thing.
Select ALSA, OSS, ESD and etc...and see if they all work.
hmm, you might to get the various sound plugins installed. For me, to get sound working with VLC was a pain =(
ok :/.. i got it working yesterday, but i re-installed my ubuntu today and really can't remember how i did it, someone told me something about typing "pkill esd" but that command doesn't seem to work
